Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Karin H
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this small and nice hotel, which has a very good location.The hotel room was clean and nice, but extremely small as a double room. We would say that room 204 is a single room with a large bed. Luckily, we travelled with hand luggage, otherwise, there would not have been room for our suitcases. The breakfast room is also a bit small, we had to queue for a seat. The staff at the hotel are very kind and helpful. So our overall rating is that it is a good and clean hotel with a very good location. The local neighbourhood (the streets behind the hotel) offers very good restaurants and authentic enviroment. It is close to many of the major tourist locations and in fine walking distance to the rest of the city. Nice location close to Forum Romanum.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: Our hotel in Rome was super close to the Coliseum - right around the corner. It was a perfect hotel with average sized, air conditioned rooms and was centrally located to everything and cheap! The people at the reception were also very helpful with providing us with city information!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Hotel Solis while vacationing in Rome. The hotel is very clean and provides a nice breakfast. The staff were very helpful and catered to our needs. The room was clean and bathroom was very nice. The hotel is so close to the Roman Forum you can walk there in about two minutes, 10 minutes to the Colosseum and about 20 minutes to the Trevi Fountain; what a perfect location. We would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, staff & location”
Reviews.Author: Wayne T
Reviews.Content: Myself & wife stayed at this hotel last weekend (20~23 Jan) and we were very happy with the overall service we received. We stayed there from Friday ~ Monday and have absolutely no complaints at all and would absolutely recommend it. The location of the hotel is perfect for all of the major tourist locations around Rome and it is only a few minutes walk from the local tube station. The staff were extremely friendly and the hotel was clean and everything we needed for a long weekend break. As you would expect the staff were extremely knowledgeable of the local area and spoke really good English and were more than happy to help us out. There was an additional charge of 7 euros for internet access in the room for the trip, which I think is reasonable. When we go back to Rome we would stay here again. Wayne & Sadie (Swindon - UK)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Seb_Phillips
Reviews.Content: A really wonderful little hotel in a fantastic location. The staff were brilliant, very helpful indeed. The rooms are basic but clean with air conditioning. For a city break or business trip of no more than a few days this really is a perfect place to stay. Planning to return to Rome later in 2012 and will defiantly stay at the Solis !

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Solis for two nights only and managed to see all interesting sights in Rome, fantastic location when you are in Rome for a short period. Close to all sights,Trastevere, and several good restaurantes. Nice, clean and quiet hotel with kind and smiling staff. Only one stop by Metro from Termini. Absolutely worth recommending. Go to Rome off season - no turists, no ques anywhere and the temp. about 12-18 degrees in January. And book at guided tour at the Colosseum only 10 min. away - Roma, we´ll be back:0)

Reviews.Title: “Our Visit to Rome September 25 to Octover 1, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Isaboenisch
Reviews.Content: We liked very much our stay in this really very small but cosy hotel (sept. 25 to oct. 1, 2011). Its situated as to reach the important sites very quickly by foot. We especially estimated the support of the very friendly staff, namely la Signora Rita Landriscina, speaking several languages, a very friendliy lady helping us a lot! We very much would like to see her again at our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price and superb service by the staff.”
Reviews.Author: esizemore
Reviews.Content: We visited the Solis for a girls trip to Rome. The hotel was quaint and excellently located just up from the Colosseum. We were able to walk to most major sites. The staff were very friendly and helpful and made the stay memorable. We hope to come back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solis, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: Surfing-Millers
Reviews.Content: They say you get what you pay for, but for the price of a room at the Hotel Solis, Rome, Italy, your charge is high and the room quality low. The motel brochure and service claimed are very misleading as the room they assigned to us (room 113) was not "restructured and elegantly taken care of in its details and endowed with every modern comfort". We "pre - paid", to get a discount and the management gave us a room that was ill kept (damaged & dirty walls, molding missing on the door & floors) and smaller than a broom closet. The bathroom was actually bigger than the sleeping area. The bed was a single for 2 adults even though we had stipulated there were 2 adults when we made the reservation. The office staff was apologetic and tried to be accommodating, yet, we were stuck in the room for our stay of 2 nights even when larger rooms were available. We requested to talk to management about the room, but the "owner" was too busy to talk with us about the room even when he was on site. Through the help of the office staff we did receive a compensated ride to the airport upon our departure.

Reviews.Title: “A super location for a short break to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: GGJC93
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Solis unsure of what to expect having read the various reviews. We had already emailed the hotel to ask whether we could leave our luggage at the hotel prior to checking in as we were due to arrive in Rome at 9am. This proved to be unproblematic. When we returned to our family room, we found it to be perfectly ample in terms of size. (It needs to be noted that our children are 16 &14 and not small tots!) It was also clean and well stocked in terms of drinks and toiletries. Breakfast was good! Plenty of bread,cheese, sweet pastries, 6 choices of cereal and drinks. For a continental breakfast, we were perfectly happy. As has been said previously, the location is first class!! We would certainly consider staying at the Solis again.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: PerFriis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central - the service is in top - the rooms are big and clean and the shower works. Room 202. The aircon could be a little better and the breakfast too. But as travelled to Rome over 10 times, this hotel is super to the price. Super

Reviews.Title: “There must be better places for this money!”
Reviews.Author: DissapointedUsa
Reviews.Content: The room was amazingly tight and didn't look so clean. Access was a bit convoluted (had to go through two different elevators and a hall way to get to a room in the second floor!). The price included "buffet breakfast": which is a joke and truly bad. The front-desk people were not very helpful. The rooms are air-conditioned but the AC does what it wants, so you will wake up sweating or freezing no matter what you set it on. The location is excellent for visiting the Forum and Colloseum but otherwise, there must be better places for the money they ask!

Reviews.Title: “Faulty towers”
Reviews.Author: Golden023
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. My husband and I had to do with a single room first night as our double was not available! My mother-in-law and sis-in-law got moved to another room the second night (dont know why). A german couple said they went out one morning and got back to find all their stuff had been moved to another room inc their money and passports from the safe! So much for security. We wont be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Can't Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: Secaucus_NJLee007
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there 3 times now. Clean , friendly service , literally a couple of blocks from the Roman and Imperials Forms and "downtown ancient Rome" It's a nice neighborhood too. The rooms are small ( as they are all over Europe ) but nicely done and they have everything you'd need ( a good bed , a nice bathroom and cool AC).It was disappointing that it was booked up for my upcoming Aug 2011 trip to Rome.Will gladly stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for sightseeing; not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: meredodysseus
Reviews.Content: I know many people have complained about rude service here, but our service was very good. The gentleman who checked us in was very accommodating when, after we were shown to our extremely tiny double room, I pointed out that I'd reserved a triple (my husband was joining my son and me the following night). He realized the mistake right away and asked if it would be okay to stay in the double for one night and that he'd switch us the following morning. That was fine with me, but I was worried I'd wake up in the morning and it wouldn't happen. Quite the contrary. It seemed the whole staff was alerted to the change. I'd repacked our stuff when the woman cleaning rooms asked if all our stuff was packed up so she could move it. The gentleman at the desk asked the same when we were in the lobby. When we returned from sightseeing, all our belongings had been delivered to our much larger triple room. We were very happy there for 5 more nights. Yes, the rooms are small. But remember, this is Europe and the buildings are old and converted to hotels. They're not like US hotels, built from scratch to accommodate us fussy Americans! If you can afford the triple room, it is much better than the double, space-wise. Room to unpack and to move around. The air conditioning in each room is controlled by you and works very well. Via Cavour is very busy, and our triple was in the front of the hotel, so it was a tad noisy. Not terrible, but when you're having a hard time sleeping anyway ... People also complain about the breakfast, which we found quite ample. They serve croissants, various breads, hard boiled eggs (depending on the day), milk, juice, and yes the coffee is from a machine. But they're not really set up to serve coffee to order, so it fit the bill. My 7-year old felt he'd died and gone to heaven when he realized he could go back for more and because they had little packets of Nutella. Considering how insanely expensive food in Rome is, it was great to have one meal a day for which we didn't have to shell out $40-60. The woman who runs the breakfast service looks a little put out, but the fact is she was extremely accommodating. We overslept our first day and missed breakfast, but because she was packing up, she let us grab a couple of croissants, which she didn't have to do. The young man behind the desk was the only one who seemed less than interested in being super helpful. He rarely looked up from his computer when you came in and out. However, when I asked if I could use the lobby computer, he told me it cost 7 euro for 3 hours. I told him I only needed a minute or two, to which he replied, "Oh, if you only need it a minute ..." and he turned the internet on for me. So, I can't really complain about him! Long review. Sorry. I just wanted people to know our experience there was lovely. And the location is PHENOMENAL. Spitting distance from the Colosseum. Fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “A SPLENDID CENTRAL HOTEL IN THE BEST HISTORICAL CITY OF THE WORLD,ROME.”
Reviews.Author: tizia007
Reviews.Content: Hi,This is a small hotel in the heart of Rome - 3 minutes away from the colisseum and 40 seconds away from the Fori Romani. The room was excellent and clean and the receptionists were all very helpful. Many thanks to all the administration and the staff of this hotel. I hope that i would come again with my family and friends in this great hotel. Thanks. Pierre.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever!”
Reviews.Author: Enovie
Reviews.Content: The worst service I have ever encountered in any hotel anywhere! We booked a double superior room for 2 nights, but were told when we checked in that there was only "a small room" available. Strange, considering I showed them my booking confirmation.. "The small room" turned out to be a single room, and barely that. When we asked to change rooms, the lady at the front desk was very annoyed and simply said no. We were told to speak to the receptionist working the next day instead. After a night of hardly any sleep, and A LOT of debating with the new receptionist the following morning, including a phone call where he actually hung up on me (!), they finally had the cleaning lady show us to a new room. No one in the staff looked me in the eye or greeted us coming or going, for the entire stay. We did eventually get a discount after speaking to the manager when we checked out, but we were never offered any kind of apology for THEIR mistake. It is easily the most uncomfortable stay in a hotel I have ever experienced. Do not book this hotel for your viist to an otherwise perfectly beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Tourist Destinations Without a Touristy Feel”
Reviews.Author: CatCon23
Reviews.Content: Although we were obviously tourist staying at at hotel only blocks from the Colosseum and Forum, surrounded by other non-Italian tourists, I never felt like I was in a typical "tourist" hotel. The rooms are AWESOMELY located near Metro, Buses, and several popular Rome destinations. Rooms had high ceilings, shutters to block out traffic noise and early morning sunlight, and REAL bathrooms, including a bidet and full-sized, always hot shower. Breakfast (included) was just enough to satisfy our hunger and prepare us for long days walking and wandering throughout Rome. Staff was decent, although not super efficient nor very versed in English, as with most Romans; they are proud Italians, and most only speak enough English to do business, not make conversation. Our favorite thing about the hotel (besides GREAT rates), is most certainly the location. Not just because I leaned out my window, drying my hair staring up the street at the Colosseum and Forum (which I did most mornings), but because of all of the LOCAL life around us. The wine and cheese shop owner sweeping the sidewalk as he rolled up the shutters and set produce (fresh pears!) out on the street to accompany his regular wares. The "deli" a block down where we ate our first Roman meal after over 24 hours of travel (and several meals during our stay), ordering "Rusticas" by the kilo. Caldo? SI! And Valentino's tratorria, where we spent lazy lunches in Spring-like weather on the sidewalk, and large, boisterous family dinners, ending with house-made limoncello. Hotel Solis is accommodating and a fine, decent place to stay, but the neighborhood and the local and personal experiences we had made it for-sure a hotel we will stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matthew140
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better location. It is a 30 second walk to the Forum and 2 minutes to the Colloseum. Regarding the previous reviews this is what you're going to get for a hotel at this price in Rome folks. Unless you pay a LOT more then you're not going to get better than this. Breakfast is very basic and the breakfast room is small but if you were to buy what you get in the hotel outside then you'd be looking at about €15-20 so it's worth eating in. Hotel staff were very helpful (in an Italian way). For our American friends visiting please remember that it's a different culture to what you may be used to with different attitudes. There was nothing wrong with this hotel so please don't be put off by the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jube37135
Reviews.Content: Best location in the city. steps away from the ruins and coliseum. Hotel staff was wonderful. Very helpful and speak english. Our room had two twin beds and was very small. about a foot in between each bed and the walls. That was the only down side. The location made up for it. I would stay there again but ask about their larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location good - service bad”
Reviews.Author: vaeltaja_80
Reviews.Content: A small hotel a stone's throw away from the Colosseum and Forum Romanum, near Piazza Venezia (=quite near good shopping streets in downtown) and Metro stations "Cavour" and "Colosseum". Our rooms were big enough but ours had a dirty old wall-to-wall carpet (not good if you're allergic like me) and it faced the street so it was so noisy that I had to sleep with earplugs (since I'm a light sleeper and Via Cavour seems to be quite a busy street even at night). The bathroom wasn't very clean either and overall the room was quite worn down. Breakfast was better than we expected (still don't expect a full continental breakfast...). The worst dissappointment, however, was the reception staff. They cheated us with the minibus transfer to the Airport (Fiumicino): They asked 80 euros (for 5 people) but we heard that the correct price would have been 55 euros only! We tried to renegotiate but the lady at the reception just shouted at us very impolitely... So they got 25 euros for one phone call... Not very good service for your own hotel guests, I would say.

Reviews.Title: “tiny, tiny rooms - but good location”
Reviews.Author: cjm108
Reviews.Content: Not good value for the money, surly staff (esp in the evening), room was barely cleaned. Very small breakfast room with indifferent service.

Reviews.Title: “Dont count on actually staying here!”
Reviews.Author: JMarshall_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its location and the fact that it was newly refurbished. On arrival we were told there were problems with the 2nd floor and were moved to another Solis hotel on the outskirts of the city. The alternative Solis hotel is half the price of the on near the colleseum, is in a rough street with a dodgy entrance hall, tiny breakfast room, and weird shaped room which shared a window with the junk room/office next door!! There was no evidence of problems on the 2nd floor of the Solis - we feel conned - we paid in advance on the internet so couldnt get any money back - we checked out 1 night early and found a nicer hotel - we would have checked out sooner if we had the money!!! watch out!!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel but clean and very close to colosseum”
Reviews.Author: nyujay2010
Reviews.Content: Don't expect much here as the lobby is nicer than the rooms. However, the room was clean, spacious, big bed but the design was seriously outdated. Typical European room regarding late 1970s feel but was a bit larger than others. The breakfast is an absolute joke but I did appreciate there being an elevator. All in all, it did the job and if you don't plan on staying in the room much it's a cheap price with an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “three stars is very very generous”
Reviews.Author: warnerpowis
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is brilliant. very close to Roman Forum, the Colosseum and the metro. However, it has to be said that is the only bonus. We stayed for 3 days and were lucky enough to check in during shift of the most fluent english speaking member of staff. The claim of multiligual staff is misleading, trying to explain the workings of the Wi-Fi was a little beyond the receptionist, as was the chance of giving change from 10E for the 7E charge! When we decided to use the PC in reception it was fortunate that an english speaking italian guest was on hand to assist when it wouldn't boot up. Our room was at best adequate. One light was broken. The TV wasn't tuned in and was therefore unusable even for background music. We always think of a hotel base for a sightseeing visit is really only somewhere to sleep so we shrugged it off. we didn't need a restaurant but had chosen the Solis as the information bumff stated there was a bar. However, it seemed to only sell coffee, and was never open after 9.00pm. As the mini bar only had soft drinks, we went elsewhere beginning to become a tad disgruntled. The breakfast was sparse to say the least. A buffet is a generous description for a pile of hard boiled eggs, some dry rolls and a coffee machine. On the whole, we were disappointed that the information for this hotel was obviously exaggerated. If a hotel is as basic as The Solis, all a traveller asks is that they are aware before checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jelopes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 days with my boyfriend on February. The staff were incredibly kind and helpfull. The room was clean and confortable. The location is great, near the best touristcs points and metro station. There are great restaurants and convenience shops on the block. We will certainly recomend Hotel Solis for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Mistake booking”
Reviews.Author: islandcapers
Reviews.Content: Location great close to colisseum, restaurants etc. Only good thing about hotel. Upon late arrival, lady behind desk was too busy to assist us as we entered as she was planning a night out with two other ladies in reception area. She also was calling other people ref party and ignored us for about l0 minutes. No assistance with bags to our room. Had to take two different elevators to get to room going along very narrow hallways. Upon entering and leaving hotel, receptionist barely looked up to greet us and was downright rude when asking for information. Room was never leaned during our stay of three nights just towels replaced. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone except for the location. Breakfast was also very minimal and not what was advertised.

Reviews.Title: “So many hotels in Rome, so no reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: brianjclifford
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend away for a surprise birthday trip, Rome was everything we hoped it would be, but this hotel nearly reduced her to tears. The service is, by a long chalk, the worst either of us have ever experienced (endured?) anywhere in the world. The old man referred to further down in these reviews is still there and "greeted" us on arrival - by giving me a room pass and taking my passport and telling me to "tell her to give me hers". 'Her' was my girlfriend, stood right next to me. We found our room, which rather than a double was two twins pushed together, passable if they'd both been the same height, but they weren't. Our romantic weekend was, literally, turning into an uphill struggle. Perhaps we could relax with "satellite TV, DVD/CD-ROM/MP3 player"? Perhaps not. This multimedia extravaganza consisted of a tiny television last seen in the early 80s, which was not tuned in and therefore did not work. The DVD/CD-ROM/MP3 player was a lie and did not exist. We asked for them to fix it, but were told nobody could do so until the morning, but you won't be surprised to know they didn't bother. Breakfast is served in a quaint/dirty little room under the stairs, which, if everything else was up to standard, you would probably like, but instead the breakfast maid sat in the cubbyhole and ignored us, other than dumping the breakfast bin on our table. Breakfast is meant to be a buffet, this could be a language barrier, but a coffee machine, a jug of juice and some slightly stale bread and pastry isn't a buffet in my book, like I say, this might be picky, but as the rest of the hotel is so utterly under par, it's hard to give the benefit of the doubt. The tablecloths, floor and walls were dirty too. The only time the staff showed any sort of interest was when nagging us to check out of the room, we had the gall to check out 10 minutes late and were harangued by calls from reception and the cleaner banging on our door. The final straw that broke this particular camel's back came at the moment of check out, when we were daft enough to ask if there was anywhere we could leave our bags while we looked around the Roman forums, in hindsight, a daft question, but for as long as I live I will never forget the old man's face as he looked me dead in the eyes and in perfect English said "NO". Cue the tears. According to this site, this is ranked 430 out of 1,308 hotels in Rome. In a funny way I suppose I should thank my lucky stars that I didn't book into one of the 878 hotels that somehow are worse than this one. I wouldn't recommend this to an enemy, let alone a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Fine room but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: aamyot
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Solis in early July 2009. The young desk attendant was cool and aloof. The hotel location is excellent - a 5 minute walk to the ancient ruins or the in the other direction to the colliseum. The room was perfectable acceptable although we had toliet paper shortages, and power outages. Our room on the 2nd floor was reached by exiting into a public stairwell and then back into the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kandiSFO
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderful place to go live as its walkign distance from teh colosseum and palantine hill

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: m1tanker6
Reviews.Content: The front desk people are very snotty and very very nasty. They talk to you like you are their servant. Is it because I'm an American and don't speak Italian?. I had to yell at one of them because he was being nasty to my wife. It's like a hassle for them when you ask them for something. We didn't have hot water for 1 day, and another day there was no water. The TV didn't work in our room. The lighting in the room is very dim. The wireless doesn't work in the room you have to go outside your room to get a signal. The room smells like wet carpet. Breakfast, make sure you go early because it will ran out. Our trip would've been perfect if it wasn't for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: osolis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. Rooms were very clean and not cramped. The location was the best part, close to the Colleseum and within walking distance of many other Roman attractions. We really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SteveC71
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated very close to Coliseum. Comfortable, clean and tidy, however could do with a bit of a spruce up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Check the Room First”
Reviews.Author: orangeblossom47
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel could not have been better for us. There were 2 adults and 1 teen in our party and we booked a triple room. When we arrived, the room we were assigned was very small and the air conditioning did not cool. We knew it would be hot in Rome in July, so we needed a hotel with AC. Eventually the put us in a larger room. The AC was just adequate. The breakfast wasn't much to speak of--cereal, tea, coffee, etc. but it got us going for the day. For the price--considering this hotel has AC, I'd recommend it. If you are traveling for a special occasion and want more luxury--look somewhere else for twice the price or more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yorkwolds
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early Spring 2009 and the temperature was perfect, August heat would be unbearable and even the romans leave. However the rooms are air conditioned. The Hotels location is ideal for visiting central Romes tourist attractions, our bedroom was 500 metres from were Julius Caesar was cremated! There are numerous eating places nearby as the hotel only provides basic continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wheninrome99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solis is a beautiful hotel in a great location. Close to Termini Station and lots of fantastic attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to find from the train station, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: dclite
Reviews.Content: I think most tourists stay north of this location, near Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon etc., but the area down around the Forum is wonderful now. There are several great , neighborhood restaurants nearby, especially around the Colosseum, and from this hotel it is only a five minute walk to the top of the Capitoline Hill for one of the best evening views in the city.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: BobbiFarina
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of a 3 week trip to Italy I was making with my 18 year old daughter. We were trying to stay on a budget with our hotel accomidations, rather to splurge on tours, food, and sight seeing. The price and location is what attracted us to Hotel Solis. Don't make the mistake we did...spend a little more money to be able to sleep/rest in comfort. The day we arrived we adviced the young man at the front desk our air conditioning and telephone were not working. He told us it would be reapired when we returned that evening. That night when we returned the night desk person had no record of our concerns and wrote it down again for someone to look at...this went on for our entire 5 days; the phone was never repaired and the air conditioning never fixed even though we registered a complaint every day, 2x's a day...it was like no one cared or even viewed it as a problem. When it is 95 - 100 degrees in Rome and you return from a day of touring you need air conditioning to sleep. Having to make telephone calls on a pay phone or using the phone in the lobby to have a personal conversation with family was not satisfactory. The room was very small and shower the smallest I have ever seen but we were ok with that. The location was perfect. Unfortunately it appears Hotel Solis goal is to get one time bookings by offering reduced rates. Do not make the mistake we made; pay a few more dollars (euros) and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mzal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solis was the perfect location for staying in Rome. If you want to see the Ancient sites like the Roman Forum, Paletine Hill and the Coliseum this is the perfect location. We selected a quad room, very difficult to find in any European city, and with 2 adults and two older teenagers, we were treated with courtesy, found the room large by European standards and the continental breakfast a perfect way to start the day. If I were to stay in Rome, I would definitely stay at the hotel Solis. Thank You Andrea

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the reviews that say 'NO AIR CONDITIONING!' - that's important in July!”
Reviews.Author: Missy_Tampa_FL
Reviews.Content: Though the location was great, you paid extra for it in ways you might not imagine. There are no, I mean NO, dining values near the Colosseum. We paid too much for rude service because our children were hungry and couldn't wait. The hotel itself is perfectly situated but, with no air conditioning, it was miserable to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: tazj37
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solis was very clean, centrally located, with friendly employees.. The room was very small. This was a first trip to Italy, and perhaps small rooms are common. I feel we did well for the price, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stop”
Reviews.Author: lewis&clark
Reviews.Content: Stay here for one night when we traveled to Rome to go on a cruise. My wife and I had 4 teenagers and a 2 year old with us. Trying to find rooms in Rome for a decent price that we could sleep 4 in a room isn't that simple. This place worked great and is in walking distance to the Coliseum. It's easy to find a place to eat and there are many small shops around. These are compact rooms, but worked just right for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: patchesvincent
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel only to find out that they had overbooked our room (that we had already paid for) and that we had to drag our stuff back up the street to another hotel for one night. We then had to check of that hotel long before Solis had a room for us. We sat in their lobby and wasted half the day we had in Rome waiting for a room. When they took us to our room it was no bigger than a large closet. The bed was smaller than a full size, bigger than a twin. The door was in awful shape, missing most of the trim. There was no room to move in the room with our suitcases and you couldn't open the window because the tv was in the way. Our bathroom was disgusting. There was hair in the shower and all of the fixtures on the wall in the bathroom fell off the wall. There was also wires hanging out of the wall. The hair dryer in the bathroom was from another hotel and was melted. Hardly any air came out of it and I burned my neck trying to use it. The staff did not heed the "Do not need room service sign" they provided for the door and the breakfast was disgusting. The staff had an argument in the breakfast room when we were there and the management offered us no discount or anything for all our inconveniences. It really ruined my stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a weekend off (or anything)”
Reviews.Author: Timpax
Reviews.Content: I must say that this was definitely the worst hotel experience in Italy ever. When we arrived they did not have our room available even though we had paid it in advance! They asked us to use their other hotel in not-so-good location which we refused. After that we were given a 4 person room (which was quite out-dated) and did not have a working AC. And the street below was probably one of noisiest in the Rome, so keeping windows open was not an option. The breakfast was couple croissants which were actually put there a day before and a cheap office-style coffee maker. So we were having terrible coffee while cleaning ladies it the next room (who obviously refused to drink that) were using a regular espresso machine. When we arrived in the evening to our room (around midnight) we noticed a couple arguing about not having their room which they had reserved months ago. It would be a hell to start looking for another hotel at midnight in Rome. After one night stay we decided that we were not going to spoil our minitrip to Rome because of this hotel so we changed to another hotel. Hotel Solis did not return our money which we had paid in advance, even though they did not have the room we paid for. Please stay away, there a plenty of better hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: hazlenutt
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem with this hotel is the staff. They act like it is an imposition to do their job and requests to unclog the shower and separate the king bed into twins (which was noted on our reservation) were never acknowledged or completed (although, a kind request to the floor maid did solve the bed situation on the last of three nights). My room was in a secondary type of building which was the top floor of an office buidling. You have to take two elevators and wind narrow halls to get there. All doors require key access, but my key kept getting deactivated and I kept getting locked out and stuck in the stairwell. The only way out is to go through the office building, which results in ugly looks because the hotel has an agreement that guests won't come down their staircase or through their foyer. We were "disciplined" twice about that, and yet the lock-out situation was met with the typical imposing attitude from the desk clerk. The hotel is not clean. The carpet on the main foyer is torn, the WC is disgusting, and my bathroom was gross. Breakfast is below average. What's great about his hotel? Location is awesome and internet is free on one computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location handy to all major attractions and links.”
Reviews.Author: Fleurdelys17
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival (eve of UEFA Champions Cup!) we were informed they were overbooked and that we would be taxi-ed at their expense to their partner hotel not far away. We accepted this and it generally went without major drama (including taxi-ing our bags back next day), but we were glad to return to the one we had booked for the other 3 nights of our stay, as it was situated far more conveniently to the locations we were to visit. The room and amenities were fine and overlooked several eateries. Our main problem while there was that they did not fix the fridge. It was lightly stocked but not turned on (not even plugged in!). When my husband plugged it in, all the power to everything else went! We reported it next morning (we reversed the power glitch), and hoped to find the fridge working in the evening, so we could keep a couple of cool drinks on hand as there are no tea/coffee making facilities in room there, but it still didn't work. We just opted to work around this minor inconvenience, and bought cool drinks from the dispensing machine down the road. We had to ask for drinking vessels of any kind for the room as well, not even a glass or cup to have a drink of water from until 2nd day when we requested it. I assumed it was just an oversight the first day, but not so. They readily provided us with paper cups downstairs that did the job. The breakfast is, as I have seen reported before, extremely basic, but that is enough for us. Just cereal and some breads/croissants, orange juice and a coffee making machine. We were within comfortable walking distance of the Colosseum + Forum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Corso etc, and between the two metro stations of Cavour and Colosseo. The day we left our area was cordoned off for the support buses and vehicles of the Giro (Tour of Italy cycle race), but that didn't bother us or hinder our plans, just added to the flavour of the experience. I would definitely recommend Hotel Solis as generally very clean and obliging in service (if not entirely thorough), and excellent location-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Marachen
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous location! Outside the doors of this hotel was the Colosseum, the Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, the metro and lots of great restaurants (although you have to search for them). Everything in Rome seemed to be within walking distance but if it was a bit farther (Vatican City) then the metro was just around the corner (5 minute walk) and relatively cheap (1 euro a trip or 4 euros a day). The hotel is basic but clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were fairly spacious. Breakfast was croissants (delicious chocolate filled ones), cereal, hard boiled eggs and tea, coffee and juice. It was basic but the croissants were fresh and delicious. Our one issue was that when we arrived they didn't have our room available so they shipped us to one of their other hotels. It didn't have the best location but it was close to the metro and a bit more quieter because it wasn't in the center of town.We had them move us to the Solis the next day and everything worked out fine. They even had our luggage shipped over while we were touring the town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donskoi
Reviews.Content: I chose the Solis above all for its location. The Colosseum is just round the corner, the Forum is across the road, the Victor Emmanuel monument and the Campidoglio just minutes away and the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain - indeed everything else - all in walking distance. We were a party of 11 and our rooms were fine. Comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms, helpful staff and a good, Italian breakfast. We all hope to stay at the Solis again and having read some of the other reviews of the hotel can only say to travellers that if you want four or five star luxury then you have to book - and pay for - four and five star hotels. But if you want a comfortable and convenient base from which to explore Rome, the Hotel Solis is unsurpassable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great desk service!”
Reviews.Author: tenplus2
Reviews.Content: You cannot get a more perfect location, close to everything, within walking distance of anything in Rome. Hundreds of restaurants, bars, gelato, fast food, gift shops all on the same block and nearby area. The front desk was very helpful, very nice and spoke good English. From the view of the street you can see the forum. The shower was a bit small, the room was huge in standards of European rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solis in Roma - Budget Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ksnavalon
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this review short and sweet. My brother and I walked from the train station to the hotel in approximately 15-20 mins (all downhill). Was a fine walk as long as you aren't lugging too many bags. I booked this hotel strictly due to location and cost (knowing we wouldn't be spending any time in our room other than to sleep and shower.) Perfect location! Less than a five minute walk to the ancient ruins and the Colosseum. We only spent two nights here so we wanted to be able to avoid cabs and walk. As far as the hotel...my brother and I are NOT picky and can handle "okay" accommodations. Our room was tiny with two twin beds pushed together. (a little too close for comfort) I easily pushed the beds apart and put the single end table between the beds to give us a bit of space. There was really no room for our suitcases but we managed. Housekeeping was average at best. The bathroom was a decent size with the exception of the shower which was quite small by our US standards. All in all...while I wouldn't go back to this hotel....it worked for us on this trip. I travel extensively and feel this review is fair and accurate. If you are a stickler for comfort and cleanliness...you may want to look elsewhere. If you are a budget...are looking for a perfect location and can "rough" it....This place is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “My feet are killing me!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLeicesterEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend stay at the Hotel Solis (Sat & Sun), our choice was influenced by other (mostly positive) reviews and it's central location. The hotel is small, and a little dated (let's itself down with an unattrative worn / dirty carpet on the staircase), however the rooms, although smallish, are clean & comfortable with an adequate toilet / shower. The breakfast room comprises a few small tables with a "help yourself" basic buffet bar. Breakfast consists of a selection of cereals, pastries, tea coffee & fruit juice, perhaps not what you are used to in England but adequate. The hotel's redeeming feature is it's location and reasonable room price. On arrival at the termini station (bus & train station) it's very easy to locate and only a 15 minute steady walk. From the hotel you can walk to the Colosseum within 10 minutes, and most other attrations and shops are close by (the hotel has a very good free pocket map at reception) Tips - Purchase a return bus ticket at Ciampino airport for the Schiaffini Shuttle bus, it is only 8 euros return, the bus stop is No. 1 directly outside the airport main building, no problems with getting on, they are very frequent and reliable. A taxi one way will set you back around 40 euros. At the termini staion, cross the road and stop at McDonalds for a quick coffee etc. (2 coffees, 2 cakes & 2 burgers only 5.90 euros). Normally I don't frequent McDonalds but the coffee is very good and the prices very cheap compared to most eateries in Rome! Leaving McDonalds turn left and walk up the road, turning left into the Via Cavour, the Solis is No. 311 on the right hand side of the street. Purchase an all day metro ticket from the kiosks in the stations, at only 4 euros each they are good value for money and will save you blisters on your feet! Check prices for coffees before ordering, most Italians drink coffee at the bar inside as they are much cheaper, a coffee in a tourist location seated outside can cost you up to 5 euros! The Sistine Chapel at the Vatican is only open on the last Sunday of the month, although open on all other days of the week. An excellent eaterie near the Vatican is the Tavola Calda Pizzeria on the Via Otaviano (53) - fantastic roast meats & potatoes. Ladies - wear sensible flat shoes or you will suffer, walking boots would be better as many of the streets are cobbled or of uneven surface, maybe not fashionable but you will be thankful at the end of the day's sightseeing !! Enjoy your stay, it's a beautiful city, very safe and interesting if a little pricey in places. For a freebie call into the Louis Vuitton shop on the Via Condotti - they give browsers in the shop glasses of wine & fruit juices & a sample chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it; it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SpartanGirl3
Reviews.Content: My husband picked this from TripAdvisor and we were not sorry. It's located close to the Colosseum and the Ruins. It was easy to get to everything in the city as two train stops were within 5 minutes walk. The rooms were clean and comfortable and breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bigeyedfish82
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying that if you are looking for the Grand Hyatt, this is not your place. However, if you are looking for an affordable hotel close to the sights of Rome, then stay here. My wife and I came here on the first leg of our European honeymoon, and we were greeted by a very friendly person at the front desk who informed us that our room was not available (construction or something) and that for the night they would have to place us in a temporary room. That room was a very tiny single, but they were apologetic and for the next four nights we had a more spacious and reasonable double. The location is very good: it is a 5-10 max walk to the Cavour Metro station and a 5 minutes walk max to the Colosseum and Forum. My wife and I spent much time overlooking the Colosseum because we would leave the hotel, walk two blocks, and be there. There is also a good number of restaurants and shops nearby, many affordable and some not tourist traps. Our double room's decor was very simple. We had a room similar to the red one shown in the pictures on this site. It was a double mattress on two twin beds pushed together, but was still comfortable. We also had a comfortable day bed. The bathroom was spacious (not large) and acceptable. The AC worked pretty well and if you are going to Rome in the summer, I would highly recommend air conditioning. The hotel was very quiet, especially at night, but if you like sleeping with the windows open be warned that they open either to Via Cavour or noisy alleys, which if you are a light sleeper may make it hard to sleep. We did not take advantage of the free breakfast. We had a good experience and would consider staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyHastings
Reviews.Content: The Solis is a brilliantly-located hotel, right in the heart of the Forum/Colosseum area near plenty of restaurants and bars. Our room was tiny, just enough room to walk around the bed, but it was a very comfortable bed and the room was clean and well sound-proofed once the windows were closed. There is no storage space other than a wardrobe (no drawers) and no chair, and the TV choice of channels didn’t include any English ones (sorry, our Italian is not that good), but we really didn’t spend a lot of time there other than to sleep. The hotel’s entry on Expedia is very impressive, the reality perhaps a little less polished – yes, there is a shower, but it didn’t stay in the rest, soaking the bathroom on one occasion. There are complimentary slippers (one pair) and toiletries (one set, not replenished). The bathroom phone must be the bigger rooms, we didn’t get that, nor the bidet. The staff are friendly and helpful, although we did arrive a little later than usual down to breakfast one day and had to swipe some uneaten croissants from another table as we obviously weren’t going to be provided with anything fresh. Continental only, but certainly enough to get us through the day. We’d go there again but if you want something fancy or are going to spend some time in your hotel, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled like a SEWER”
Reviews.Author: wilburwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel, thought it was in a great location! My husband and I and our two teenage daughters go up to our quad room. As soon as we open door a horrible sewer smell over takes us. Try to call the front desk only to find out the phones don't work. The room has a cot and a chair pullout to make up for the two extra beds. We told the front desk multiple times during our 4 day stay about the phone and smell, they said they would tell the owner. Nothing!!! We were told the smell was normal because it is an old building. We went past other rooms with there door opened and no smell! We kept the bathroom door closed and window opened most of the time. Even after we left, my husbands leather coat still smelled like the room! YUCK! It was a very busy holiday then, otherwise we would of moved to a different hotel. The breakfast was simple but nice. The only good thing I can really say is that the Location was great! Next time I think I would try and stay at the Hotel Forum or another Hotel nearby. If you are to stay here, do not get a quad room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Rome on foot”
Reviews.Author: elizabethkay
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose the Hotel Solis because of it's location, which was wonderful. During our 10-day stay in Rome, we walked almost everywhere from the Solis -- the forum, Coloseum, Piazza Venezia, and St. Peter in Chains were minutes away. Only the Vatican, Spanish Steps and Termini areas were what we considered to be longer walks (a few miles), and the Villa Borghese on the north edge of town was a cab ride away. There were a few places on our street to buy groceries, which we put in the mini bar in our room. Almost all of the staff were very friendly. One young staff member even helped us open a bottle of wine from Frascati after we messed up the cork. The rooms at the Solis were small (we had a room with two twin beds that might as well have been one double bed), but we didn't spend much time there. The biggest drawbacks to the Solis were that the beds were very hard, the room cleaning was inconsistent and the breakfast room was small -- sometimes it was not possible to get a table and we would take a few pastries to go. That said, we much preferred staying at the Solis because of its location to staying in another area of Rome, such as near Termini or the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: rachndean
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews prior to us booking we were not sure what to expect....We were very happy with this hotel. The reception staff were excellent, very chatty and more than willing to help, so the rude lady (mentioned in other reviews) was nowhere to be seen!!! We were there for a week so she has probably been fired! Yes, our room was small, but very clean and had no problem with the decore!!! Some of the other rooms looked quite large. If you are after a hotel about 500metres from the colosseum with excellent choice of restaurants in the street and only 10-15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, then you wont do much better than this one. Free internet was a bonus! We also walked all the way to the Vatican from the hotel, didnt die from it either!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: SmieyHappyMama
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and clean, this hotel was our favorite (besides a gem in Tuscany) for our small budget. They were doing construction at the time, and our room was actually a bit difficult to get to, having to carry out suitcases up a flight of stairs to reach our floor...but it was no big deal and the room was worth it. A/C worked GREAT and everything was very clean and pretty. It reminded us of a Mariott-type stay in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IreneATL
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel because it was a cheaper option compared to everything else that were available. I didn't enjoy the stay, but I guess it is as good as it gets with the price tag.. - Room: The dark-colored decor (wallpaper and drapes) made the room very dark, even after we turned on all the lights in the room (there isn't that many lights). - Safe: The room doesn't have a safe in it. This is the very basic thing we look for in a hotel and am disappointed they don't have it. It worried me a lot when we go out especially when Rome isn't the safest city in the world. - Vacancy indicator: There was this funny design on our door, where there is a light that indicates whether you are in or not, depending on if you put the key card on the power switch. We found this annoying because people could just walk up and see who's in or not, and potentially break into the rooms that are empty at that time. - Maid: It isn't a big problem, but the maid tends to overlook things. One day she didn't give us toilet paper, then another day she gave us only one bath towel. - Internet: There is in-room WIFI internet if you pay 5 Euros for it. However, it was broken on our last day, and the front desk didn't know how to fix it (or didn't even try to). - Location: Many people praised about the location of this hotel. It is true that it is right next to the colosseum. However, it is on a main street, and the area looks questionable and I didn't feel safe staying there. Personally I liked the area around the Spanish Steps a lot better, but I am sure the hotels are a lot more expensive over there. It is convenient, however, as the bus (I think it was 117) stops right in front of the hotel, and it goes to many tourist spots. - Noise: Noise is usually not something I complain about, but there were construction noise starting around 8 or 8:30am in the morning. It does get quite annoying if you want to sleep pass 8am. The safe is the most basic thing any hotel in major cities should offer. It is a deal breaker for me regardless of how cheap the place is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: orbital
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hotel I have stayed at in Rome. The rooms were quite nice & it was so very close to everything. It was very nice to be able to step back in and drop things off or just rest for a moment. There is a GREAT restaurant just behind the hotel too. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sammy64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, no doubt about it. The room was a fair size, very clean, with a good size bathroom. Our room was at the front of the hotel, the noise was definately blocked out. Great easy reach Colloseum, Forum and many other sites. nice local restaurants, for a special treat go to the top of Forum hotel just around the corner. fabulous view of the Forum. I would stay here again if I had a first floor room. two negatives, breakfast is very basic. But at the price we paid for the room we lived with it (120eur p/night). secondly our room was on the second floor. beware - rooms 201-205. These rooms are accessed by going in one lift to the first floor, then leaving this floor through a fire exit type door and entering a rear stairway. this part of the building is under renovation and was dusty. A lift from here took you to the 2nd floor, back through a fire exit type door to the five 2nd floor rooms. A strange arrangement, which took a bit of getting used to. This hotel is great value, especially if you get a room on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel ideal position”
Reviews.Author: BigPhilWarboys
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because the reviews in trip advisor were quite good. We were not dissapointed. Ideall location for the forum and surrounding area. Easy walk to the trevi and Pantheon. Rooms very clean, no noise and breakfast ok. Perhaps only gripe was the room was a bit small but we only slept there.The bathroom was good, clean and shower was hot. If you want to stay close to the centre then this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Suited Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: talynnschool
Reviews.Content: This was a really well situated hotel for all the ancient Roman sites. It was small but comfortable and all the staff were very friendly towards us. We managed to walk there easily from the station and we found some pleasant local restaurants nearby. The train was very, very crowded going into Rome from the airport and we found it easier to get a taxi back to the airport despite a taxi strike on our day of departure.The hotel concierge took great trouble to arrange a private hire car for us for only ten euros more than the train fare.

Reviews.Title: “There was not room at the inn”
Reviews.Author: elviradrabble
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to be with a group of sixteen but together with another couple, we booked this hotel independantly. A few days before travelling our friends (the other couple) were contacted by Solis to say there was a problem with their Debit card. My friends were unable to speak to anybody but were informed they had been booked into another hotel. The four of us arrived at the Solis to be told that we had been moved as well. The staff member informed me that he had done everything to solve 'my' problem and had tried several hotels before he could get us a place as it was a very busy weekend. Both couples had booked this hotel in October 2006 as we were part of the group who were there to run in the Marathon. That weekend was also the Italy/Ireland rugby game which is why we booked so early. We had chosen that hotel because it was close to the start of the race. We had to move to another hotel which was a lot further away and not our choice. My confirmation and accepance e-mail counted for nothing. i had booked in good faith well in advance and could not believe that our booking would not be honoured. The staff member was unable to explain if there had been a problem with my friend's debit card, why he had booked them into another hotel. Also, why he had done the same to us. Incidentally, there was no problem with the card and he would not admit to having sold our rooms to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the banging!”
Reviews.Author: Brownbuddies
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was really impressed because it is so close to Termini Station (so we could get a 11 euro train from the airport instead of a 50 euro cab) and also just around the corner from the Colleseum. The receptionist spoke English and was very polite and the room was clean and a reasonable size. The only thing I could possible complain about was the fact that at 8am every morning we were awoken by incessant banging from 8am. We didnt really feel we should complain since we were getting up to go sightseeing anyway, but its not the greatest way to start the day. The breakfast is pastries, coffee, hot choc, cereal, bread and jam, orange juice etc, and is self service which is nice because I hate having to sit around waiting to be served when all I really want to do is wolf down a snack and get out to see the sights and oh what sights there are just on your doorstep. I wouldnt stay there again, but only because of the banging, everything else was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....staff needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: dmancini`
Reviews.Content: You never get a second chance to make a first impression! When my husband and I arrived at the hotel we were greeted (if you could call it that) by a woman at the front door yelling on her cell phone. We did not think that this person could have been an employee due to the fact that she was yelling on her cell phone and was very poorly dressed. She signaled to us to wait so she could conitinue yelling on her cell phone with her back turned to us. Some 15 minutes. At some point she signaled to my husband for our passports. We got them out and she walked up to my husband took them out of his hands and went behind the front desk. She was still on her cell phone. She found our reservation handed us our room key and told us it was on the first floor. Also while still on her cell phone. We got to our room which was clean and a good size, only one problem we couldn't get the lights on. We DID NOT want to go back to ask her anything! Finally I relented and went down to the front desk. Surpise she was still on her cell phone, still yelling! I waited politely to be acknkowledged, no luck so I got her attention and asked about the lights and she said I had to use the room key then turned around and continued her phone call. We got settled and headed out to see the sights. As we entered the lobby she was not there, the front door was open and our passports were sitting out on the counter. We waited around to see where she was. About 5 minutes later she strolled in from outside. My husband asked for our passports back as we did not feel our property was at all safe in her hands. As I said the location was great and very easy to get to all the major sights on foot. Our room was cleaned daily and very well. The breakfast that is offered is very basic, the room it is served in is small and cramped. The woman that ran the breakfast room while we were there was not rude but made you feel horrible when you requested coffee or anything else of her. There was one gentleman on staff that ran the hotel in the morning and we felt that he was only one that was at all competent and service oriented. However because of our first experience with the woman at the front desk we never felt completely at ease. We even decided to leave hours earlier that we need to for the airport because we were so worried about having to store our luggage at the hotel. I am sure everything would have been fine but there was serious trust issue. If you don't mind a hotel with no interest in service then this was not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little gem”
Reviews.Author: vamp555
Reviews.Content: My mum and I booked this hotel for our second trip to Rome and we were not disappointed. It is in such a great location, a two minute walk to the forum and opposite the hotel next to the gran cafe cavour is a side street which takes you to the colliseum within 5 minutes. The hotel was clean and we had a great room overlooking the bustling street. The double glazing was soundproofed so you really didn't know how busy the street was until you opened the patio doors. The breakfast was basic, rolls, cereal and croissants, but nevertheless plenty of it and the staff were friendly. The checking in process was slow, but as said before the staff were friendly and spoke good english. The pizzerias and cafes along the via cavour are plentiful so when you come in after walking all day you didn't have to go far to eat later on. All in all I would strongly recommend this hotel, location being the key element.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: zmxncbv
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel was clean and the room was an excellent size. The bathroom was very modern and looked new. I absolutely loved this hotel and would stay there again next time I am in Rome. The colosseum is a 5 minute walk. The Trevi Fountain is about 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “First no booking, then no water?!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: We booked via email with the Hotel Solis direct and looked forward to our stay in central Rome. Sadly after dragging our cases one mile downhill from the station, the rather animated receptionist slammed shut her guest book and told us she had no record of our booking! I handed over my confrmatory email which she snatched and proceeded to make a number of angry staccato Italian phone calls. She then tried to make us go to a sister hotel out of town which we refused, and later admitted our booking did exist, but the room had no water! Funny on reflection, but at the time we wearily trudged back uphill trying 15 other hotels before we found a vacancy. Not exactly the first night in Rome we'd envisaged!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would echo a previous review about this hotel - the best thing about it is most certainly its position. I took my mum and we wanted to stay near the Colosseum. Unlike the other 4 star more expensive hotels which are near to it, this is about 5 mins walk away but nearer the other landmarks and I think, in a much better position. It is on the junction of via Cavour which if you look left can you can see the Colosseum, look in front and the Forum is straight opposite or look right and you are 5 minutes from the wedding cake building on the Piazza Venezia. This is situated at the end of via Corso (main shopping street) which, if you walk along for 10 mins (it will take longer if you're window shopping!), you will arrive at the Trevi Fountain - my personal fave!! So all the main landmarks are either within very easy or reasonable walking distance. This was fantastic because we were able to get great photos walking to Trevi on our first night then take amazing floodlit photos on our way back!! Looking at the other hotels positions, this was by far the best! There are a few nice little restaurants nearby if you've walked your feet off in the day and want to stay close to the hotel. The twin room we had was basic but very clean with air con (nice sized bathroom), breakfast was better than the last bread and jam effort we had when we stayed in a dive near the termini station and the staff here were pleasant and helpful. The red 101Open top bus runs from the other side of the Colosseum (hop on-hop off at various places) and will take you to Piazza Navona (near Pantheon) and St Peters among other places. The bus cost 13 euros for adults. Entry into the Vatican Museum (Sistine Chapel) was 12 euros each but the best deal is a guided tour round the Colosseum for £20 euros each (inc fast-track entrance). This price also includes another guided tour of the Forum (no entry fee but a free tour's a free tour!) AND a further guided tour of Paletine and fast-track entry included! If you don't want to walk from place to place, there is a metro station, taxi rank and bus stops right outside the Colosseum. I saw more in my two days this time than 4 days last time because 1) I knew my way round better 2) the hotel was completely central to EVERYTHING and 3) I didn't once have to tackle the termini station/ignorant staff there or the cheapo Terravision bus to/from the airport (our one extravegance was taxi to/from the Ciampino airport which gave us more time to look around). FABULOUS - DEFINITELY GOING BACK (AGAIN!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location rates above average/room and service- average”
Reviews.Author: tanddGaithersburg_MD
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel and that is why we decided to book here and were not at all disappointed. Near to the Colosseum and the Forum, close to 2 metro stops and in walking distance of the Trevi Fountain and the Navona Piazza. We took the metro to the Vatican and the Piazza de Popolo and it was very easy and fast. We also needed room for 4, 2 children and 2 adults, which this hotel offered but it was very crowded. But again we were not in the room much at all! The bathroom was small but had a shower door, what a find! The front desk staff was helpful and in particular, one gentleman who spoke English pretty well. We had to use some of our hastily learned Italian but that of course is the fun part of traveling. We did ask for extra pillows and received them. The air conditioning was not very strong and we needed to ask the bell captain how to turn it on (again in my basic Italian). The hotel is located on a busy street but the thick windows blocked out most of the noise, not a problem at all for us and I am a light sleeper. Breakfast was fine. We did have one problem: we asked twice at the front desk if the car service took credit cards, the answer was yes. We got to the airport and the driver, who spoke little English, said no credit. We didn't have much euro left but after much trying in my basic Italian again, we got him to take euro and American dollars!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Solis
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cavour 311, 184 Rome, Italy
